channel.title: Free Analyst Notes
channel.description: Recent content on Free Analyst Notes

item.title: CFA Level 2: Alternative Investments (part 1)
item.description: Alternative investments cover real estate, commodities, hedge funds, private equity, and more. Each of these has its own unique risk and reward features.

item.title: CFA Level 1: Quantitative Methods (part 2)
item.description: Quantitative methods covers statistical topics including descriptive statistics, hypothesis testing, and more.

item.title: CFA Level 1: Quantitative Methods (part 1)
item.description: Quantitative methods covers statistical topics including descriptive statistics, hypothesis testing, and more.

item.title: CFA Level 2: Fixed Income (part 1)
item.description: Fixed income covers the topic of bonds and other coupon-like investment securities.

item.title: CFA Level 1: Alternative Investments (part 1)
item.description: Alternative investments is a growing field full of potential profit opportunities. Learn about the basics here.

item.title: CFA Level 1: Economics (part 1)
item.description: The CFA level 1 exam covers economics in great detail, specifically, macroeconomics. It covers demand and supply, market structures, and more.

item.title: CFA Level 1: Equities
item.description: The CFA Level 1 exam covers the topic of Equities which includes market orders, indexes, market structure, and more.

item.title: CFA Level 1: Ethical and Professional Standards (part 1)
item.description: Ethics is a commonly failed topic in the CFA exams. It can be quite tricky, so it is critical to thoroughly understand the topic. We hope our notes help you grasp the main points.

item.title: CFA Level 1: Ethical and Professional Standards (part 2)
item.description: Professional Standards (cont) Professional Standards (cont) Duties to Clients Loyalty, Prudence, and Care Have a duty of loyalty, act with reasonable care, and exercise prudent judgment Must act for the clients’ interests and place their interests before their employer’s and own self-interest Make investment decisions in the context of the entire portfolio Allowed to make preparations for future employment while still employed, as long as it doesn’t affect loyalty to current employer

item.title: CFA-Level-1-GIPS
item.description: Global Investment Performance Standards (GIPS®) Overview Key Characteristics Requirements of GIPS® Compliance Statement Major Sections of GIPS® Compliance with GIPS Global Investment Performance Standards (GIPS®) Overview GIPS® apply to investment management firms in order to benefit their current and prospective clients FIRMS MUST be defined as an investment firm, subsidiary, or division held out to clients or PROSPECTIVE CLIENTS as a DISTINCT BUSINESS ENTITY.

item.title: About Hugo
item.description: Hugo is a static site engine written in Go. It makes use of a variety of open source projects including: Cobra Viper J Walter Weatherman Cast Learn more and contribute on GitHub. Setup Some fun facts about Hugo: Built in Go Loosely inspired by Jekyll Primarily developed by spf13 on the train while commuting to and from Manhattan. Coded in Vim using spf13-vim Have questions or suggestions?

item.title: (Hu)go Template Primer
item.description: Hugo uses the excellent Go html/template library for its template engine. It is an extremely lightweight engine that provides a very small amount of logic. In our experience that it is just the right amount of logic to be able to create a good static website. If you have used other template systems from different languages or frameworks you will find a lot of similarities in Go templates.

item.title: CFA Level 1: Quantitative Methods (part 3)
item.description: Quantitative methods covers statistical topics including descriptive statistics, hypothesis testing, and more.

item.title: CFA Study Topics
item.description: CFA Level 1 Ethical and Professional Standards GIPS Equities Economics Quantitative Methods Derivatives Corporate Finance Portfolio Management CFA Level 2 Alternative Investments CFA Level 3 Alternative Investments
